It can also interfere with the way your medications work. It's best to discuss this with your doctor, who can provide specific advice based on your health condition. Patient: And what precautions should I take if I choose to drink alcohol?

Nurse: doctor can That's a great question, Mr. Peck. Alcohol can affect your blood sugar levels. It can cause them to rise or fall, depending on how much you drink and how your body responds. If you choose to drink alcohol, it's important to do so in moderation. This means no more than one drink per day for adults.
